abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey a satisfactory
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Lessons drawn from the
            project address the following subjects. A technical
            assistance (TA) project provides valuable support for
            preparing, and strengthening implementation of an adjustment
            operation, thus it makes sense to extend, and adapt the TA
            projects in line with the changes in emphasis of policy
            reform. However, the Bank needs to take a more realistic
            view of the time it takes to carry out TA-supported capacity
            building, for it was clear from earlier operations in
            Armenia, that twenty one months was a serious underestimate
            of the time to build capacity for major economic reforms.
            Furthermore, better donor coordination at the outset, would
            more accurately signal the availability of grant funding
            preferred by the Borrower, given a TA project can leverage
            additional amounts for capacity building from other donors,
            and in addition, Bank TA can complement other donor funding
            in an important way, by financing the use of local consultants.
